SWS #801 Stopped.

SWS #801 Scheduled to arrive 179th and Orland Park at 7:31 am is currently stopped at Forest Hill due to a Mechanical issue on train #802. Estimated time of this delay is unknown. We will update this information once it becomes available.

ME Train 712 Delayed Departure

ME train #712, scheduled to depart University Park at 7:45 AM, will be delayed in departure due to  signal problems. The duration of this delay is unknown. Metra will provide updates as information becomes available.

UP-W Train #18 Will Not Operate

Train #18 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 7:02 AM, will not operate past College Avenue. Train #22, scheduled to arrive Chicago at 7:32 a.m., will accommodate passengers.  Visit metratracker.com for the location of your train. Updated at 6:33 a.m.

UPW Train 20 Will Operate ahead of 18

Train 20, scheduled to arrive Ogilvie Transportation Center at 7:20 AM, will operate ahead of train #18 due to mechanical problems involving train #14. Visit metratracker.com for the location of your train.

Train #36, scheduled to depart Elburn at 7:55 a.m., will not operate due to mechanical problems.  Train #38, scheduled to depart Elburn at 8:25 a.m., will accommodate passengers.

SWS train #803, scheduled to depart Chicago Union Station at 7:27 AM, will not operate due to mechanical problems. Train #805, scheduled to depart Chicago Union Station at 8:27 AM will accommodate  passengers.

LaSalle Street station escalator #2 is out of service. Metra will provide updated information once service has been restored.

UP-NW Cary Station will not be ADA accessible beginning August 20, 2025.
On Wednesday, August 20, 2025, the Cary station will not be ADA accessible due to construction. Customers can use Pingree Road and Fox River Grove as alternate boarding stations.

SWS #812 Will Not Operate

SWS train #812, scheduled to depart 179th Street/Orland Park at 8:42 AM, will not operate due to mechanical problems. Train #814, scheduled to depart Manhattan at 9:56 AM will accommodate  passengers.

UP-NW Park Ridge Station will not be ADA accessible on August 18-19

On Monday, August 18, to Tuesday, August 19, the Park Ridge station will not be ADA accessible due to construction. Customers can use Edison Park and Dee Road as alternate boarding stations. Updated at 1:07 p.m.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 87th street/Woodruff Station Closure Beginning December 16 - Station Rebuild Project

The 87th street/Woodruff station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, December 16. During this time passengers can use 83rd and 91st street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, the station will have an enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrance, lobby with an elevator, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage. The station is expected to reopen in late 2025. For more information visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 79th Street/Chatham Station
The 79th Street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric may not be fully ADA accessible Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - The 95th St/Chicago State University station will close March 3, 2025 - Station Rehab and Expansion Project

On Monday, March 3, the 95th st/Chicago State University station will close for approximately 2 years to undergo a rehabilitation and expansion project. During this time passengers should use 91st street and 103rd st/Rosemoor stations as alternates. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  103rd St./Rosemoor Station ADA Accessibility.
Monday through Friday, from 9AM to 4PM, the 103rd St,/Rosemoor station may not be fully ADA accessible due to nearby station construction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Fox Lake Station Platform Closure

Attention Fox Lake Station passengers: The north end of the Fox Lake platform and a section of the north parking lot will be closed until further notice for construction at the depot. Trains will load and unload from the south end of the platform.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Beginning May 9, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station Reconstruction

Beginning May 9, 2025, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station reconstruction. Full site construction is expected to continue through Spring 2026. An accessible alternative is the 111th Street Morgan Park Station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is restored.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-NW - Beginning June 2, 2025, the Pingree Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station construction.

Beginning June 2,2025, the Pingree Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station construction. ADA access will resume late 2025. Passengers requiring full accessibility should use Crystal Lake station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is fully restored.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert SWS - Oak Lawn Platform Rehabilitation (UPDATE)

Beginning Monday, June 30, platform rehabilitation at Oak Lawn Station will begin its final phase. The west half of the platform is closed. Passengers should watch their step as the platform is currently gravel during this process. Please allow additional time to access the in-service portion of the platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Michigan and Randolph Elevator Out of Service

The Michigan Avenue elevator located on the southwest corner of Michigan and Randolph is permanently out of service. Customers can use the South Water elevator, 225 N Michigan Avenue, or McCormick Place as an alternate boarding station.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-W - Wood Dale Parking Lot Resurfacing Project  - July through August, 2025

The Village of Wood Dale will be resurfacing parking lots 2, 3, and 4. The project will occur in two phases, starting the first week in July through the end of August. Please allow additional time when traveling to the station.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Ingleside Platform Rehabilitation - Beginning Monday, August 4

Beginning Monday, August 4, the east half of platform #1 will be out of service for rehibilitation for approximately 5 weeks. After completion of the east half, the west half of platform #1 will be out of service for approximately 4 weeks to complete the project.  Metra apologizes for any inconvenience.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Forest Glen Station- southwest staircase will be out of service

Beginning Monday, July 28, the southwest staircase will be out of service for rehabilitation until friday, August 29, 2025. Please use the pedestrian tunnel to access the northwest staircase at Forest Glen Ave, to access Platform 2.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Morton Grove Partial Parking Outage

Due to ongoing construction of the new Morton Grove Metra Station and temporary reduction of the site's accessory parking, an existing 105-space municipal parking lot located at 8550 Lehigh Avenue will be made available to the public for permit parking starting August 1, 2025, through October 31, 2025. Click here for more details.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Millennium Station-South Water Street Entrance Phase 1 Work Starts August 11.

South Water Street entrance Phase 1 work starts August 11.

Metra Passengers requiring elevator access to Millennium Station platforms may continue to use the elevator at 225/205 N. Michigan Ave.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Village of Glenview Commuter Parking Lot Improvement and Expansion

The Village of Glenview is set to begin an improvement and expansion of the commuter parking lot located northwest of Grove and Depot Street. The parking lot will be closed for 4 weeks, beginning August 4 through August 29 to build these improvements. Parking will be limited during this time and commuters may consider using the North Glen Station. Click here for more details.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-NW - UPNW Notice of Construction Beginning Monday, August 4 through Friday, September 19.

A project to replace thousands of ties on the UP Northwest Line over a two-month period will require Metra to cancel trains 648, 654, 621 and 627 begining Monday, Aug. 4, and continuing through Friday, September 19.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Beverly Branch of Metra’s Rock Island Line will be shut down the weekend of Aug. 22-24, Morgan St. Bridge replacement

The Beverly Branch of Metra’s Rock Island Line will be shut down the weekend of Aug. 22-24 for the replacement of the Morgan Street Bridge in Chicago. Service on the Beverly Branch will be shut down on Friday evening, with outbound Train 631 (the 6:40 p.m. departure from Chicago) and inbound Train 632 (the 5:35 p.m. departure from Joliet) as the last trains to serve Beverly Branch stations. Following the closure, inbound Trains 514, 516, and 518 and outbound Trains 511, 513, 515, and 517 will make additional stops at the Gresham, 95th Street /Longwood and 103rd Street /Washington Heights stations on the Rock Island mainline. Weekend trains also will make additional stops at Gresham, 95th Street /Longwood and 103rd Street/Washington Heights. Service is expected to be restored in time for the rush hour on Monday, Aug. 25.
